title: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang speaks to NSA Doval, calls for lasting ceasefire with Pakistan
content: War is not the choice of the Indian side and is not in the interest of either side, Mr. Doval underlined

title: India-Pakistan ceasefire LIVE: Peace deal struck, but Pakistan violates ‘understanding’ along border
content: Every future escalation will invite a decisive response, says Government; Pakistan says ‘remains committed’ to truce after India claims violations

title: Toll collection begins on NH 209 stretch linking Bengaluru to Kanakapura despite incomplete service roads; residents and commuters upset
content: The NHAI is upgrading the NH 209 corridor, an important stretch connecting Bengaluru to Dindigul in Tamil Nadu, into a double-lane road

title: 41 A.P. students reach New Delhi from Kashmir
content: An official release said that of the 41 students who returned to the national capital, five had left for their hometowns.

title: Tamil Nadu way ahead of the rest of the country in Gross Enrolment Ratio: AICTE Chairman
content: Prof. Sitharam said Tamil Nadu has a Gross Enrolment Ratio (GER) of more than 50 per cent in higher education, while in the rest of the country it was only 29 per cent

title: Don’t celebrate my birthday, Shivakumar tells followers
content: He also appealed to the party leaders, party workers, followers and fans not to put up flexes, banners, hoardings or advertisements on May 15.

title: Soldier killed guarding air base after Pakistani drone strike in J&K’s Udhampur
content: The Indian Air Defence successfully intercepted the drones in the air, but a jawan was hit by a fallen debris resulting in critical injuries to him

title: Is safe harbour important for social media? | Explained
content: What is intermediary liability? How does safe harbour protect social media platforms from legal action?

title: IIT Kharagpur to strengthen well-being of students after three suicides this year
content: Since January 2025, three student suicides have been reported at this IIT campus, and multiple others were reported last year

title: What will be impact of India-U.K. trade deal? | Explained
content: How long was the free trade agreement in the works? When is it expected to be signed and implemented? Which are the sectors likely to benefit apart from textile and automobiles? What are the challenges for agriculture and medium and small enterprises?

title: Survey for new railway line in Sikkim sanctioned
content: The 75 km track is proposed to connect Melli, on the State’s boundary with West Bengal, to Dentam on the India-Nepal border

title: Despite ceasefire, cross-border firing from Pakistan reported across Jammu border
content: Earlier on Saturday, as Pakistani troops moved closer to western border, BSF fortified its presence and Army put armoured units in Rajasthan on high alert.

title: GCDA to fund developing of open spaces in nine municipalities
content: Aluva, Angamaly, Thrikkakara, Kalamassery, Thripunithura, Maradu, Eloor, North Paravur and Perumbavoor muncipalities have been selected for the first phase of the project

title: Opposition parties want Modi Government to share ceasefire details, shed light on U.S. role
content: Congress contrasts Modi Government’s stance with the one taken by Indira Gandhi in 1971; demand for special Parliament session to discuss war

title: MoS Defence represents India at 80th Victory Day celebrations in Moscow
content: MoS Defence Sanjay Seth extended congratulations to Russian President Vladimir Putin, and discussed India-Russia military cooperation with his counterpart, Col. General Alexander Fomin.

title: ‘Excess deaths in 2020 and 2021 not equal to deaths by COVID-19, increase attributable to several reasons’
content: India’s cumulative excess mortality for 2020 and 2021 was 9.3% higher than the expected deaths, lower than that of the U.S., Italy, and Russia, a senior Union Health Ministry official said, referring to new data from the official record of births and deaths

title: Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra ink MoU for Tapti Basin Mega Recharge Project
content: The inter-State initiative aims to address water scarcity across regions of both States; Centre likely to be approached for national project status

title: Markets reopen in Rajasthan’s border areas; blackout to continue in three districts
content: Ceasefire between India and Pakistan brings relief to Rajasthan’s border districts; markets reopen, and security measures continue

title: New lifetime tax on commercial vehicles draws flak from small operators
content: Updated policy replaces quarterly system with a one-time payment, which many operators say will hit small business owners the hardest

title: Ramakrishna Mission secretary urges support for India amid Pakistan conflict, calls non-retaliation a sin
content: Swami Suvirananda stresses spiritual duty to resist attacks; political leaders react as ceasefire between India and Pakistan takes effect

title: Concerns mount over waste-to-energy project at Deonar amid pollution fears
content: Govandi residents, activists flag health and environmental risks; call for environmental impact assessment and project suspension

title: Cross-border shelling leaves five civilians dead in Jammu and Kashmir
content: In first such instances, loud bangs were reported by locals as unidentifiable projectiles hit scores of houses in many urban centres, including twin capitals of Srinagar and Jammu

title: An alliance and poll arithmetic
content:
Electoral tie-ups are critical to the Dravidian majors in Tamil Nadu and the recent decision of the AIADMK to go with the BJP, after suffering a drubbing in the 2024 
Lok Sabha election, goes to prove this. However, it remains to be seen whether the 
AIADMK-BJP combine could overcome the formidable challenge of the 
DMK-led alliance

title: West Bengal district schools shine in State board exams, top ranks across categories
content: With the declaration of results of the class 10, class 12 and High Madrasah exam of the West Bengal board last week, certain schools shine through in each merit list, boasting of multiple students in the top ten rank list

title: India Pakistan Tensions LIVE Updates: India Confirms Pak Ceasefire Violation, No Drones Spotted In Srinagar
content: Pakistan Ceasefire Violation LIVE Updates: Security forces remained on high alert, hours after Pakistan violated a ceasefire that was to come into effect from 5 pm on Saturday.

title: "Fight, Fight, Fight": Trump's Assassination Attempt Statue Spotted At Oval Office
content: The statue depicts Trump defiantly raising his fist in the air moments after being hit in the ear by one of would-be assassin Thomas Matthew Crooks' bullets on July 13.

title: Donald Trump's "Total Reset" Remark After Marathon US-China Tariff Talks
content: Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng met for about eight hours with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer in their first face-to-face meeting.

title: Act Of Terror Explained: These Terrorist Acts May Be Treated As Act Of War
content: The government would treat any future act of terror as an act of war, top sources said amid continued drone attacks and cross-border shelling by Pakistan.

title: "Uske Vaade...": Shashi Tharoor's Poetic Jab At Pak For Ceasefire Violation
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Saturday took a poetic jab at Pakistan after it violated the ceasefire within hours of reaching a deal with India amid simmering tensions.

title: Sheikh Hasina's Awami League Banned By Bangladesh's Yunus Government
content: Bangladesh's interim government on Saturday banned the Awami League, the political party of former prime minister Sheikh Hasina, pending the outcome of a trial over its crackdown on mass protests that prompted her ouster last year.

title: Medical Assistant In Air Force Killed In Pak Air Strike In Udhampur
content: Surendra Kumar, a resident of Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu, who had been working as a medical assistant for the Indian Air Force, was killed in a Pakistani air strike early on Saturday in Udhampur, Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Iran Will Not Back Down From Nuclear Rights, Foreign Minister Says
content: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi said on Saturday that if the United States' goal is to deprive Iran of its "nuclear rights", Tehran will never back down over those rights.

title: Suspicious Movement, Exchange Of Fire Near Jammu's Nagrota Military Base
content: A sentry was injured in a brief gunfight with a suspect at an army camp in Jammu region today. The incident was reported from Nagrota Military Station.

title: As Pakistan Violates Ceasefire Within Hours, China's Remarks Raise Eyebrows
content: Minutes after Pakistan violated the barely-hours-long ceasefire, with J&K chief minister Omar Abdullah and Gujarat home minister Harsh Sanghavi taking to X over drone sightings, China told Pakistan that Beijing "stands firmly" with Islamabad.

title: "Breach Of Understanding By Pakistan": India On Ceasefire Violations
content: Hours after the ceasefire was announced, India said on Saturday evening that Pakistan has violated the understanding and the Army is responding appropriately.

title: Read India's Full Statement On Ceasefire Violations By Pakistan
content: For the last few hours, there have been repeated violations of the understanding arrived at earlier this evening between the Directors General of Military Operations of India and Pakistan.

title: Trump Says "Full, Immediate" India-Pak Ceasefire After "Long Night Of Talks"
content: In a massive statement after four days of hostilities, US President Donald Trump has said India and Pakistan have agreed to a "full and immediate" ceasefire following a "long night of talks" mediated by the United States.

title: Explosions Heard Across Srinagar, Says Omar Abdullah After India-Pak Ceasefire
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah in a post on X said he heard some "explosions" in Srinagar.

title: Border Force Trooper Killed, 7 Injured In Pakistani Shelling In Jammu
content: A BSF trooper was killed and seven others were injured in Pakistani firing along the International Border in Jammu on Saturday, officials said.

title: "Conditional" Ceasefire, No Change In India's Position On Indus Treaty: Sources
content: The ceasefire with Pakistan is a conditional one and there is no change in India's position on the diplomatic measures against the neighbouring country, including the suspension of the Indus Water Treaty, sources have said.

title: "Firm, Uncompromising Stance Against Terrorism": S Jaishankar On India-Pak Ceasefire
content: Minutes after India announced a "full and immediate ceasefire" with Pakistan, Foreign Minister S Jaishankar issued a stern message for harbourers of terror

title: Vyomika Singh, Sofia Qureshi On X? Centre Fact Checks Fake Social Account
content: The government has flagged fake X accounts impersonating two Indian military officers -- Wing Commander Vyomika Singh and Colonel Sofia Qureshi -- warning the public against engaging with or sharing posts from these handles.

title: Kochi Corporation’s ABC centre to strengthen operations with more staff
content: Two more veterinary surgeons are to be appointed, in addition to the one full-time surgeon and a Corporation surgeon who visits the unit thrice a week; deployment of two more vehicles is expected to increase the daily capture of stray dogs

title: Recent rank holders share their success stories
content: The session provided valuable insights to young participants of the The Hindu Civil Service Gateway Summit 2025 into personal systems, work ethic and strategies adopted by the winners

title: How will India’s military response be assessed under international law?
content: An evolving doctrine in international law allows states to use force extraterritorially in self-defence against non-state actors if the host state is ‘unwilling or unable’ to take measures to neutralise the threat

title: Govt. says peace deal with Pakistan was struck without mediation
content: Officials say the two countries reached an understanding ‘directly’, appearing to refute U.S. statements on brokering a deal.

title: Santhosh Kumar, Santhosh Echikkanam, Shafi Poovathinkal win O.V. Vijayan Awards
content: Award distribution ceremony, scheduled for May 18, may be postponed due to rising tensions along the national borders

title: Miss World jamboree begins with a cultural extravaganza in Hyderabad
content: The opening ceremony was a colourful spectacle of folk and tribal dance traditions from across Telangana, choreographed in a parade-style presentation that celebrated the region’s rich cultural roots

title: Irrigation Minister asks engineers to fast-track Sita Rama and Sitamma Sagar projects
content: Dy. CM Bhatti, Ministers Ponguleti and Tummala attend meet to help speed up all components of the two projects

title: CBI arrests five persons for allegedly selling SIM cards in violation of KYC rules
content: The agency conducted searches in eight States as part of ‘Operation Chakra-V’ against transnational organised cybercrime syndicates

title: From block prints to big dreams: Haryana women weave success
content: In Rohtak district, Haryana, about 350 women who are a part of self-help groups engaged in sewing and block printing, are earning in lakhs, bolstered by individual talent and collective determination. Ashok Kumar reports on how they are changing the way society — particularly men — think of housework, money, and a woman’s participation in the home and the economy

title: Meghalaya group opposes ecotourism project in wildlife sanctuary
content: The ₹23.7 crore project includes the construction of tourist dwellings, glass skywalks, and a water sports area

title: First batch of government model school students in Thoothukudi shines in national-level entrance exams
content: The school was in 2023 and all the 74 students admitted to Class XI have now completed their higher secondary education with some even securing admission

title: Slain jawan Murali Nayak’s mortal remains reach his hamlet in A.P.’s Sathya Sai district, funeral on Sunday
content: Hundreds of people line up along the procession route and pay tribute to the martyr; Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan, Ministers Nara Lokesh, Satya Kumar to attend final rites to be performed with military and State honours

title: Medicines increasingly being routed to Karnataka from external markets through unauthorised distribution channels, warns chemists’ association
content: In a letter to all pharma manufacturers, BDCDA president B. Thirunavukkarasu has said these unauthorised movements often bypass company-appointed carrying and forward agents (CFAs) and stockists

title: Displaced locals start returning home, as J&K parties hail ceasefire agreement
content: The agreement to halt hostilities brought immediate hope to border villages, with residents returning on Saturday and prominent J&K political figures, including CM Omar Abdullah and Mirwaiz Umar Farooq, expressing relief.

title: Time for world leaders to disarm Pakistan’s nuclear arsenal: Owaisi
content: The International Monetary Fund loan to Pakistan is international militant fund, says AIMIM president

title: Nipah patient’s condition remains critical
content: Six persons from the high risk category are currently under treatment at different hospitals. Four of them are at Government Medical College Hospital, Manjeri

title: State Chief Information Commissioner restrains Anjaneyulu from functioning as Secretary (FAC) of APIC
content: Through an administrative order, Mahaboob Basha asserts that the appointment made by the Chief Secretary without consulting the APIC contravenes both the Right to Information Act and G.O. 122

title: Govt.-backed millet cafe inaugurated in Kochi
content: The cafe was opened as part of a government effort to promote the inclusion of millets in daily diets to help address diseases such as diabetes

title: Seven tea estates in Vandiperiyar face threat of closure
content: The management has failed to provide wages and  benefits to employees of  Pambanar, Granby, Munjamullay, Nellikai, Thengakal, Injikadu, and Pasumallay estates for the past five months, according to workers

title: Six arrested for thrashing teenager to death in Belagavi
content: The Athani Police have booked the six on the charge of thrashing to death the teenager for trying to steal from a furniture shop

title: The Hindu Huddle 2025: ‘India’s strength is in its linguistic diversity’
content: Laxmikant Deshmukh said it was irrational on the part of the State government to “impose Hindi as a third compulsory language from the Class I”.

title: Crisis intervention centre for transgender people to come up at Kakkanad: Minister
content: The centre will function as a safe space for transgender individuals facing emergencies, offering mental health support, legal guidance, and crisis management

title: Long night and a sudden turnaround: 10 things that happened after India-Pakistan ceasefire deal
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, India and Pakistan agreed to a ceasefire after US intervention. However, the truce was quickly violated, with explosions reported in Srinagar and drone intrusions in border regions. India retaliated, and Foreign Secretary Misri condemned Pakistan's actions. China's Wang Yi spoke with NSA Doval, emphasizing the need for regional stability.

title: ‘Uski fitrat hai mukar jaane ki’: Tharoor’s poetic swipe at Pakistan
content: Tensions flared as Pakistan allegedly violated the ceasefire agreement shortly after its signing, prompting strong reactions from India. Shashi Tharoor criticised Pakistan's unreliability, while Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri urged responsible action. Explosions were reported in Srinagar and border districts, with Pakistani drones detected and neutralized.

title: 'Flight adjustments & longer wait times': Delhi airport issues travel advisory
content: Delhi Airport operations are proceeding normally despite heightened security tensions between India and Pakistan. Passengers are advised to expect potential flight schedule adjustments and longer security wait times due to evolving airspace dynamics and stricter protocols. Travelers should rely on official updates from airlines and the airport, cooperate with personnel, and arrive early to accommodate possible delays.

title: County Cricket takes a dig at Virat Kohli amid retirement buzz
content: Following reports of Virat Kohli's potential Test retirement, the County Championship's social media account took a dig, suggesting he's avoiding England's pace attack. This comes after Kohli's underwhelming performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. With Rohit Sharma's recent Test retirement, Kohli's departure would create leadership and experience void for India's upcoming English summer.

title: Melinda French Gates opens up on Bill Gates plan to give away all his wealth
content: Melinda French Gates supports the Gates Foundation's plan to spend its $200 billion endowment by 2045 on global health, emphasizing the original intent to give back to society. The foundation will double its spending to combat diseases and poverty. French Gates believes billionaires have a moral obligation to contribute, hoping for lasting positive impact even after the foundation closes.

title: PIB fact-checks fake X accounts of Wing Commander Singh and Colonel Qureshi
content: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has flagged fake X accounts impersonating Wing Commander Vyomika Singh and Colonel Sofia Qureshi, both prominent figures in Operation Sindoor press briefings. These accounts, some with blue ticks, have amassed significant followers.

title: Venkatesh Prasad reacts strongly on Pakistan's ceasefire violation
content: Venkatesh Prasad strongly criticized Pakistan for violating the ceasefire agreement shortly after it was announced. This followed a formal agreement between both nations to end hostilities. Explosions in Srinagar and the interception of Pakistani drones by Indian forces heightened tensions. Prasad emphasized Pakistan's instability, urging India to respond decisively after the recent terrorist attack in Pahalgam and Operation Sindoor.

title: 'Fight, fight, fight': Statue of Trump's assassination attempt at White House
content: A sculpture commemorating the July 2024 assassination attempt on President Trump, depicting him raising his fist and shouting "Fight! Fight! Fight!", has been installed in the Oval Office. The White House shared an image of the statue, which portrays the moment after Trump was shot in the ear during a Pennsylvania rally.

title: When LinkedIn co-founder told employees: Go home, have dinner with family...
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman believes work-life balance is incompatible with startup success, advocating for a relentless work ethic. He argues that those prioritizing balance are not fully committed to winning, emphasizing the intense demands of the startup environment. Hoffman points to the financial rewards reaped by early LinkedIn employees as justification for his demanding approach.

title: 'Ghatiya desh ne fir ... ': Dhawan tears into Pakistan over ceasefire violation
content: Following a ceasefire agreement, Pakistan allegedly violated the truce by launching drone attacks on Indian regions like Srinagar and Kutch. This provocation has sparked outrage in India, with cricketer Shikhar Dhawan condemning Pakistan's actions. The BCCI has reportedly halted plans to resume IPL 2025 amid security concerns, while Indian defence forces remain on high alert.

title: Mother's Day 2025: Images, quotes, wishes and GIFs
content: Mother's Day, celebrated annually on the second Sunday of May, honors mothers and mother figures. Originating from ancient festivals and later popularized by Anna Jarvis in the United States, it became an official holiday in 1914.

title: iPod inventor warns: Hiring 15-year Googlers can hurt company culture
content: Tony Fadell, the iPod inventor, argues that Silicon Valley's lavish perks are stifling innovation. He contrasts Apple's critical, high-pressure environment with Google's relaxed culture, where he believes excessive freedom breeds mediocrity. Fadell advises startups to avoid entitlement, warning that fancy perks cannot replace the hustle needed for breakthroughs, drawing from his experiences at Nest and General Magic.

title: Soldier injured in firing at Nagrota Army station in Jammu
content: An alert sentry at Nagrota Military Station thwarted a potential intrusion, sustaining minor injuries during a brief exchange of fire. Simultaneously, a precautionary blackout was enforced in parts of Punjab. India reported ceasefire violations by Pakistan, responding firmly and maintaining a strong vigil along the border and Line of Control after terrorist attack in Pahalgam.

title: 'War was not India's choice', NSA Ajit Doval tells China's Wang Yi
content: Amid escalating tensions, NSA Ajit Doval and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi discussed the Pahalgam terror attack. Doval emphasized India's counter-terrorism focus and commitment to a ceasefire, despite Pakistan's provocations. Wang condemned the attack, urging restraint and dialogue, while supporting a comprehensive ceasefire.

title: Pakistan shelling kills 2 Army men, an IAF Sergeant and a BSF SI in Jammu
content: Intensified shelling and drone attacks by Pakistani forces across the Jammu region resulted in the loss of four Indian security personnel. Among the casualties were an Army JCO and a rifleman, an IAF sergeant stationed in Udhampur, and a BSF sub-inspector positioned along the international border in the RS Pura sector.

title: Can living near golf courses give you Parkinson's? New study reveals how
content: A recent study reveals a concerning link between living near golf courses and an increased risk of Parkinson's disease. Individuals residing within a mile face a significantly higher chance of developing the condition, potentially due to pesticide exposure. Researchers advocate for public health initiatives to minimize pesticide contamination and protect nearby communities.

title: WWE Backlash: John Cena controversially retains title, and more
content: WWE Backlash 2025 delivered a night of intense action from St. Louis, featuring Jacob Fatu retaining his US title after Jeff Cobb's debut. Lyra Valkyria defeated Becky Lynch, while Dominik Mysterio retained against Penta with El Grande Americano's help.

title: Putin ready for direct talks with Ukraine ‘without any preconditions’
content: Amidst escalating tensions, Vladimir Putin has proposed direct peace talks with Ukraine in Istanbul on May 15, without preconditions. This offer follows a demand from European leaders for a 30-day ceasefire, backed by the US, to be monitored by international partners.

title: ‘Great progress made’: Trump on US-China tariff talks being held in Switzerland,
content: President Trump announced "great progress" in US-China trade talks in Geneva, hinting at a potential "total reset" in relations. Discussions, led by US and Chinese officials, aimed to ease trade tensions following tariff hikes. While expectations remain modest, the resumption of dialogue is viewed positively, with potential tariff de-escalation on the horizon.

title: EOS-09 sat set for launch to boost India’s border surveillance powers
content: India's surveillance capabilities are poised for a significant boost with ISRO's upcoming launch of the EOS-09 (RISAT-1B) radar imaging satellite on May 18. Equipped with advanced C-band synthetic aperture radar, the satellite will provide high-resolution images regardless of weather conditions. This strengthens border surveillance along sensitive areas with Pakistan and China, while also aiding in anti-terror operations and coastal monitoring.

title: Pak violates ceasefire: Blackouts in J&K, Punjab, Rajasthan, Gujarat
content: Shortly after a ceasefire pact between India and Pakistan, multiple firing incidents and drone attacks erupted along the international border and LoC, impacting regions from Jammu and Kashmir to Gujarat and Rajasthan. India retaliated, shooting down drones and damaging Pakistani posts, while border residents were urged to seek shelter.

title: Gangster Chhota Rajan acquitted in 21-year-old case
content: Gangster Chhota Rajan was acquitted by a special CBI court in a 21-year-old case due to a key witness's uncertainty about the identity of the threat caller. Rajan was accused of ordering a violent shutdown of a construction site in 2004 after a builder allegedly failed to pay the dues.

title: Cargo, check-in baggage now under CISF scanner
content: Amid heightened security concerns, the government has temporarily expanded the CISF's role at Indian civil airports. Effective May 9-18, 2025, CISF will oversee cargo and check-in baggage screening, previously managed by airport operators and airlines. This enhancement aims to reinforce security arrangements, with CISF personnel conducting random checks and overseeing access control to critical facilities.

title: Booze-related health problems spiked in AP from 2019 to 2024: Data
content: A recent Andhra Pradesh health department study reveals a significant surge in alcohol-related liver, neurological, and kidney problems between 2019 and 2024, coinciding with the YSRCP regime. The study highlights a dramatic increase in patients aged 35-44, raising concerns about the quality of liquor available during that period amidst allegations of a "liquor scam."

title: Sheikh Hasina’s Awami League banned by Bangladesh’s interim government
content: Bangladesh's interim administration has banned the Awami League, the party of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, under the anti-terrorism law. This ban, pending formal notification, will remain until the International Crimes Tribunal concludes trials against the party and its leaders regarding events before and during their rule, which ended after a July 2024 uprising.

title: 'I can walk away without any regrets': Virat Kohli
content: Reports suggest Virat Kohli is considering retiring from Test cricket, prompting reactions from cricketing legends like Brian Lara. Kohli emphasized the demanding nature of Test cricket, highlighting the mental and physical fortitude required to excel. He expressed a desire to guide younger players, ensuring a seamless transition and continued success for Indian cricket.

title: 'K***e ki dum tedi ki tedi ... ': Sehwag attacks Pakistan
content: Virender Sehwag criticized Pakistan's ceasefire violation, highlighting the broken truce with a Hindi idiom. Despite agreeing to a full ceasefire mediated by the US, Pakistan targeted areas along the International Border and LoC. This breach followed India's 'Operation Sindoor,' a response to a deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, escalating tensions between the two nations.

title: 'Armed forces remain operationally ready': India after ceasefire announcement
content: India and Pakistan have reached an agreement to halt all military operations across land, air, and sea, with instructions issued to their respective armed forces to adhere to the understanding. The decision follows a call between the Director Generals of Military Operations from both sides, with further talks scheduled for May 12.

title: 'No damage to S-400, BrahMoS missile base': MEA exposes Pak's misinfo campaign
content: The ministry of external affairs revealed Pakistan's misinformation campaign. Pakistan falsely claimed damage to Indian military assets, including the S-400 and BrahMos missiles. They also alleged damage to airfields and ammunition depots. India clarified its secular values, denying allegations of damaging mosques. This followed India's strikes on terror camps and an agreement to halt military action.

title: 'Firm stance on terrorism will continue': EAM after India, Pak agree to stop military ops
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar announced that India and Pakistan have reached an understanding to halt firing and military actions, reaffirming India's firm stance against terrorism. This agreement followed a call initiated by Pakistan's DGMO, with both sides agreeing to cease military activity on land, air, and sea.

title: Vladimir Putin's "Direct Talks" Proposal To End Russia-Ukraine War
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday proposed direct talks with Ukraine on May 15 in Istanbul. Following are key quotes translated into English by Reuters. "It was not Russia that broke off negotiations in 2022. It was Kyiv. Nevertheless, we are proposing that Kyiv resume direct negotiations without any preconditions." "Despite everything, we offer the Kyiv authorities to resume negotiations already on Thursday, in Istanbul." "Let me remind you that as a result of these negotiations, a joint draft document was prepared, and it was initialed by the head of the Kyiv negotiating group, but at the insistence of the West, it was thrown into the trash." "Russia has repeatedly made ceasefire initiatives." "Kyiv authorities have not responded to any of our ceasefire proposals." "During the three days of the declared ceasefire, Kyiv has made 5 attempts to attack the Russian border." content: india and Pakistan agree to a ceasefire after a fourth day of strikes and counter-strikes . the two countries have used common sense and great intelligence . this is what global leaders have said about the latest developments between the nuclear-armed neighbours .

title: C's regain form, tap into 'darkness' in Game 3 win
content: The Celtics got off to a blistering start from the 3-point arc and never looked back as they blew out the Knicks 115-93 in Game 3.

title: Astros' McCullers, family receive death threats
content: A team spokesperson said the Astros notified both the Houston Police Department and Major League Baseball security about the threats made at Lance McCullers Jr. and his family.

title: Padres hang 21 on woeful Rox; GM backs Black
content: Rockies GM Bill Schmidt backed manager Bud Black before the Rockies' 21-0 loss on Saturday night dropped Colorado to 6-33 on the season.

title: Saints kick off QB competition as Carr retires
content: Saints starting quarterback Derek Carr has decided to retire because of a labral tear and degenerative rotator cuff injury in his right shoulder, leading the team to begin its QB competition in earnest.

title: Andersen, Canes blank Caps, capture series lead
content: Bouncing back from a Game 2 loss in Washington, Carolina veteran goaltender Frederik Andersen made 21 saves as the host Hurricanes defeated the Washington Capitals 4-0 on Saturday night for a 2-1 lead in their Eastern Conference second-round series.

title: Judge goes deep twice, pushes MLB HR lead to 14
content: New York slugger Aaron Judge celebrated his return to the Sacramento area by hitting two home runs Saturday afternoon at Sutter Health Park in a losing effort for the Yankees against the Athletics, extending his major league-leading total to 14.

title: Browns QB Gabriel embracing addition of Sanders
content: Browns rookie quarterback Dillon Gabriel is embracing the team's selection of fellow signal-caller Shedeur Sanders, saying the two can "learn from one another."

title: For Taylor, Commanders stint chance to 'represent'
content: Gabe Taylor wore a burgundy Commanders jersey with No. 26, the same number his late brother, Sean, wore at the University of Miami. Gabe said he's hoping to represent Sean this weekend.

title: 🏀 Prospects to watch at the NBA draft combine
content: With 120 players expected at the NBA draft combine in Chicago, here's everything to watch out for and know.

title: Barcelona-Real Madrid: Why this is the most important Clásico in years
content: El Clásico is always huge, but with Barcelona and Real Madrid meeting so late in the season with a title still on the line, this is one for the ages.

title: Why four of MLB's top closers are struggling -- and if they can bounce back
content: Emmanuel Clase is just one of baseball's elite 2024 relievers who has had issues this season. But all hope might not be lost ... yet.

title: Dias fumes at Southampton: They didn't even try
content: Manchester City defender Rúben Dias sounded off over Southampton's style of play after the two sides drew 0-0 in the Premier League on Saturday, accusing them of "not even trying to play."

title: Atleti's Sørloth nets earliest-ever LaLiga hat trick
content: Atlético Madrid striker Alexander Sørloth scored the earliest hat trick in LaLiga history as part of four goals in the first half hour to fuel a 4-0 rout of Real Sociedad on Saturday.

title: Ancelotti praises Alonso: He has 'all doors open'
content: Carlo Ancelotti said Xabi Alonso has "all doors open" as he leaves Bayer Leverkusen, praising the "fantastic job" the man expected to replace him at Real Madrid has done with the Bundesliga side.

title: Salah: Slot impact at Liverpool surprised me
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has admitted the impact of Arne Slot at the club following Jurgen Klopp's exit surprised him.

title: Angel City's King 'stable' after on-field collapse
content: Angel City defender Savy King was "responsive and undergoing further evaluation" after being stretchered off the field following a "medical event" during the team's match against the Utah Royals on Friday night.

title: Flick: Lewandowski to start on bench in Clásico
content: Robert Lewandowski, Alejandro Balde and Marc Casadó are all fit for Sunday's Clásico, but Barcelona's Hansi Flick has said they start on the bench vs. Real Madrid.

title: Chelsea edge Liverpool, finish WSL unbeaten
content: Chelsea completed an unbeaten season in the Women's Super League with a 1-0 home win over Liverpool on Saturday.

title: Inside the goals of WNBA's next CBA -- travel, roster size, and yes, pay
content: Increased salaries, revenue sharing and salary cap are among the issues being negotiated for WNBA's new CBA.

title: UFC 315 LIVE: Results and analysis for Muhammad vs. Della Maddalena

title: NBA playoff takeaways: Celtics rediscover offense in Game 3 rout

title: Bayern pay tribute to Müller during title party
content: fans paid tribute to the 35-year-old before his last home game for the club . the supporters behind one of the goals displayed a huge red and white tifo with pictures of Müller celebrating and lifting trophies . he shouted as he brought the picture and a bouquet of flowers to the sideline .

title: Everything to know about Monday's draft lottery, from picks to what we're hearing
content: the 2025 NBA draft lottery brings its annual wave of intrigue Monday . the entire league descending on Chicago and offseason proceedings fully underway for most every franchise . at least 13 teams in the lottery hang heavily on which combinations are drawn . a host of intriguing young players -- many freshmen -- behind them .

title: Derek Carr retires: Who will start now? What's his legacy?
content: Jeremy Fowler joins "SportsCenter" to discuss Derek Carr's retirement . medical scans determined that Carr had sustained a labral tear and had significant degenerative changes to his rotator cuff . it's the closure New Orleans has been looking for since April 11 .

title: Power Rankings: Tigers make top-5 debut as Mariners, Royals are on the rise
